mdRecord.dcterms:description: Cannon, Spanish constitution obelisk and gazebo

The plaza has been a central part of St. Augustine since 1573 when it was first laid out by the Spanish Royal Ordinances. The Ordinances required that the plaza be laid in a rectangular shape according to the compass points, with the length equal to 1 1/2 times the width in order to promote harmony. The plaza earned its proper name for the obelisk that was erected to celebrate the Spanish Constitution of 1812. -- https://www.visitstaugustine.com/thing-to-do/plaza-de-la-constitucion [work]
